title: 'A wonderful innings' - Bethell's brilliant knock ended by Starc
description: Jacob Bethell's memorable innings comes to an end as he's caught for 154 by Alex Carey, off the bowling of Mitchell Starc to leave England 328-9, with a lead of 146 on day five of the fifth Ashes Test in Sydney.

title: Rumoured Solskjaer return to Man Utd 'seems ridiculous'
description: Match of the Day pundits Danny Murphy and Stephen Warnock look at who should take charge at Manchester United following Ruben Amorim's departure earlier this week.

title: Wilson will have his 'pick of clubs' - MOTD's Murphy
description: Match of the Day's Danny Murphy analyses Fulham's Harry Wilson's current form and "intelligent" winning performance against Chelsea.

title: Weekly sports quiz:  How many managers have Man Utd had since Ferguson?
description: How much attention have you paid to what's happened in the world of sport over the past seven days?

title: England futures at risk - Ashes player ratings
description: Find out who got a 10 and who is facing an uncertain international future with our Ashes player ratings.

title: A warrior touched by tragedy - Terry Yorath obituary
description: Former Wales captain and manager Terry Yorath, who has died aged 75, had a glittering career, but his life was deeply affected by two tragedies.

title: Ranking the top American tennis players as 2026 begins
description: Coco Gauff won another major title in 2025, and Taylor Fritz continued to lead the American men. But who else is set to make a move in 2026?

title: Newcastle score twice in stoppage time to win seven-goal thriller
description: Harvey Barnes scores twice as Newcastle come from behind to beat Leeds in a dramatic seven-goal thriller at St James' Park.

title: Semenyo strikes late as Bournemouth edge out Spurs
description: Antoine Semenyo scores a stunning late winner in what is likely his final game for Bournemouth as they beat Tottenham in dramatic fashion at Vitality Stadium.

title: Sesko scores twice but Burnley fight back to hold Man Utd
description: Manchester United are denied victory in their first game since the sacking of head coach Ruben Amorim as relegation-threatened Burnley fight back to claim only their third point in 12 games.

title: Wilson goal helps Fulham beat 10-man Chelsea
description: New Chelsea head coach Liam Rosenior watched from the stands as Harry Wilson's fine finish condemns his team to defeat by west London rivals Fulham at Craven Cottage.

title: Thiago scores twice as Brentford beat Sunderland
description: Igor Thiago scores twice to continue his excellent recent form as Brentford sweep Sunderland aside at the Gtech Community Stadium.

title: Man City draw with Brighton as title bid continues to falter
description: Manchester City make it three games without a win, after Brighton's Kaoru Mitoma scores from outside the box to cancel out Erling Haaland's first-half penalty.

title: Defensively, we are more stable than ever - Guardiola
description: Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola is pleased with his side's defensive performance highlighting Max Alleyne as "exceptional" in their 1-1 draw at home to Brighton.

title: Keane's actions not deliberate - Moyes on red card
description: Everton manager David Moyes was not happy with the decision for Michael Keane to be sent off as it was "not a deliberate action", but has no sympathy for Jack Grealish who received two quick yellow cards for dissent.

title: Why the NFL play-offs are the 'most unusual' in years
description: Even NFL veterans are struggling to call this season's play-offs, with so many big names out and an array of young stars ready to battle for Super Bowl glory.

title: 'Nobody can get hold of him' - what happened to David Batty?
description: England midfielder David Batty vowed to have "nothing to do with the football industry" after retirement. As his former clubs Newcastle and Leeds prepare to meet, BBC Sport asks: what happened to him?

title: From Aronimink to Zalatoris - an A-Z of golf in 2026
description: It could be a struggle to match the tumultuous highs of last year but there is still plenty to look forward to in the coming 12 months, writes Iain Carter.

title: In Pictures: Sporting photos of the week
description: A selection of some of the most striking sports photographs taken around the world over the past seven days.

title: Tactics, transfers and turmoil - inside the fall of Amorim
description: After 14 months, Ruben Amorim has been sacked by Manchester United - but where did it all go wrong?

title: Spider-Man‚Äôs greatest battle spans the multiverse
description: Peter Parker wants people to forget he is Spider-Man, but Dr Strange‚Äôs spell goes wrong.

title: Booze, beach, beaten - how England lost the Ashes
description: BBC Sport chief cricket reporter Stephan Shemilt reveals the inside story of England's Ashes defeat in Australia on and off the pitch.

title: I've realised I can make a difference - Hoy
description: In a new BBC documentary, Sir Chris Hoy shows how he is using his Olympic mindset to reframe his purpose following a terminal cancer diagnosis.

title: The man behind the headlines - Salah, by Klopp, Diaz and more
description: BBC Sport explores Mohamed Salah's personality with help from the people who know him best.

title: Inside McLaren's season - the rules, values, incidents & relationships
description: Intra-team title battles turn toxic far more often than not. Andrew Benson analyses how McLaren have maintained relative harmony between Lando Norris and Oscar Piastri.

title: England's AI World Cup masterplan - from perfecting penalties to powering players
description: BBC Sport hears from inside the England setup about how artificial intelligence is powering plans for next summer's World Cup.

title: 'Raise hell' - the fastest bowler you might not have heard of
description: The story of Duncan Spencer, the "frighteningly fast" bowler who could have played for England or Australia.
